| A page:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | [monst.c#line3144](/wiki/Monst.c#line3144 "Monst.c") |

The **page**, @, is a [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian"). Like player and [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") knights, they are lawful.

Pages can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") to become [knights](/wiki/Knight_\(player_monster\) "Knight (player monster)").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Encyclopedia entry

A male servant or attendant; specifically, in chivalry, a lad or young man in training for knighthood, or a youth of gentle parentage attending a royal or princely personage.

\[ Webster's Comprehensive International Dictionary of the English Language ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 965](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/mondata.c#L965)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.](/images/3/37/Nh364-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Page

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ page
Difficulty 7
Attacks Weapon 1d6, Weapon 1d6
@ page
Difficulty 7
Attacks

Weapon 1d6, Weapon 1d6

Base level 5
Base experience 66
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 10
Alignment 3 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A page:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line3144

The page, @, is a Knight quest guardian. Like player and player monster knights, they are lawful.

Pages can grow up to become knights.[1]

Encyclopedia entry

A male servant or attendant; specifically, in chivalry, a lad or young man in training for knighthood, or a youth of gentle parentage attending a royal or princely personage.

[ Webster's Comprehensive International Dictionary of the English Language ]

References

  1. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 965


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.
